text: Bokermannohyla flavopicta is a frog that lives in southeastern Brazil. Scientists have seen it only over 1500 meters above sea level. The adult male frog is 51.9–65.3 mm long from nose to rear end and the adult female frog is 60.2–61.6 mm long. The skin on the frog's back can be gray or brown with darker brown marks. It has small yellow spots on its mouth, face, sides, legs and rear end. ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Bokermannohyla flavopicta
